column15: Industry or Sector (as in Lic123: e.g. automotive, consulting, education, food and drink, business services)

column5: Application for Certification Street Artist or Craftsperson
column8: Since 1972, the Street Artists Program, under the direction of the San Francisco Arts Commission, has encouraged talented artists by licensing them to sell their work on the cityâ€™s bustling streets. Anyone wishing to sell their work through the program must obtain a certificate to do so.
column10: Allows you to sell handmade art on San Francisco city streets.
column14: Those artists who are not prepared for same-day licensing are allowed up to fifteen (15) working days after the initial screening (Last Thursday of every month) to obtain their Street Artist Certificate to avoid a repeat of the screening process.

column8: The fictitious business name statement shall be filed with the county clerk of the county in which the registrant has his or her principal place of business in this state or, if the registrant has no place of business in this state, with the Clerk of Sacramento County. Nothing in this chapter shall preclude a person from filing a fictitious business name statement in a county other than that where the principal place of business is located, as long as the requirements of this subdivision are also met.
column10: Allows you to "Do Business As" a name other than your given name, eg. the title of your business.

column5: Statement of Withdrawal from the Partnership Operating Under Use of Ficticious Business Name
